name: Ensure CCSID ASCII | UNICODE | EBCDIC column clause is not used
description: This rule checks if CCSID ASCII | UNICODE | EBCDIC column clause in CREATE TABLE statement is used in DB2 Database(s).
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: As you decide to migrate from DB2 to MySQL, it is important to note the changes to be taken care of during the migration process. Without adapting the changes, the SQL script won’t compile for MySQL, leading to error.
remediation: Remove DB2 CCSID ASCII | UNICODE | EBCDIC column clause as it is not supported in MySQL.
remediationSample:
CREATE TABLE CCSID_EBCDIC
 (C1 CHAR(4),
  C2 CHAR(4),
  C3 GRAPHIC(4),
  C4 VARCHAR(4),
  C5 VARCHAR(4)
)
sample:
CREATE TABLE CCSID_EBCDIC
 (C1 CHAR(4) CCSID EBCDIC,
  C2 CHAR(4) CCSID EBCDIC,
  C3 GRAPHIC(4) CCSID EBCDIC,
  C4 VARCHAR(4) CCSID EBCDIC,
  C5 VARCHAR(4) CCSID EBCDIC
  )
alternativeName: Ensure CCSID ASCII | UNICODE | EBCDIC column clause is not used

technicalCriteria.name: Database Migration - DB2 Database to MySQL
